heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 30 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (198°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.7 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (down 165 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 235 m), feels like temperature (down 2.3°C), dew point temperature (down 2.4°C), and outside temperature (down 2.0°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 165.5m higher than yesterday, 158.4m lower than the past week, 235.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 696m and a high of 976m, averaging 1000.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, air moisture should feel ok and very little to no wind will be present. Chance of light rain, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and it’s dark. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
